songs.title: Coming Up Close
songs.lyrics:
One night in Iowa, he and I in a borrowed car
Went driving in the summer, promises in every star
Out in the distance I could hear some people laughing
I felt my heart beat back a weekend's worth of sadness

There was a farmhouse that had long since been deserted
We stopped and carved our hearts into the wooden surface
We thought just for an instant we could see the future
We thought for once we knew what really was important

Coming up close
Everything sounds like welcome home
Come home and oh, by the way
Don't you know that I could make
A dream that's barely half-awake come true
I wanted to say -
But anything I could have said
I felt somehow that you already knew

We got back in the car and listened to a Dylan tape
We drove around the fields until it started getting lat
And I went back to my hotel room on the highwa
And he just got back in his car and drove awa

Coming up close
Everything sounds like welcome home
Come home and oh, by the way
Don't you know that I could make
A dream that's barely half-awake come true
I wanted to say -
But anything I could have said
I felt somehow that you already knew

Coming up close
Everything sounds like welcome home
Come home

Coming up close
Everything sounds like welcome home
Come home
Come home

description.plain:
“Coming Up Close” was the second single from Til Tuesday’s sophomore album Welcome Home. It was a minor hit in the US, peaking at #59 in early 1987.

A reviewer for the New York Times shared:

In the group’s most interesting song, ‘'Coming Up Close,’‘ Ms. Mann describes a romantic epiphany after driving through the cornfields of Iowa with a friend and listening to a tape of Bob Dylan’s music. Returning to her hotel room, the singer experiences a deep, exhilarating sense of purpose and spiritual connection.

The album presumably gets its title from the chorus of the song.

json.embed_content: Read “Coming Up Close” by Til Tuesday on Genius
